results.title: Amphibian - Wikipedia
results.description: Amphibians are ectothermic, anamniotic, four-limbed vertebrate animals that constitute the class Amphibia. In its broadest sense, it is a paraphyletic group encompassing all tetrapods, but excluding the amniotes (tetrapods with an amniotic membrane, such as modern reptiles, birds and mammals).

results.title: Two Wildlife Tunnels Are Saving Thousands of Amphibians From Being Crushed by Cars in Vermont
results.description: New research finds a pair of underpasses installed under a road that crosses a migration corridor have led to an 80.2 percent reduction in amphibian deaths

results.title: Saving amphibians: Wildlife tunnels prevent road deaths - Earth.com
results.description: Roads are deadly for amphibians. A Vermont project proves that wildlife underpasses can make a major difference.

results.title: Why Amphibians Are Especially Threatened by Global Warming - A-Z Animals
results.description: Global warming is heating the environments of amphibians, leading to hot temperatures that the animals can't tolerate.
